dataSources.webCacheParameters: LAYERS, TRANSPARENT, SERVICE, VERSION, REQUEST, EXCEPTIONS, FORMAT, SRS, BBOX, WIDTH, HEIGHT
dataSources.comment:
This is an example of a WMS Data Source. It provide layers from e-Atlas, with WebCache capabilities. It also define a "layer group", which show multiple layers as one layer in the "Add layer window" and as a folder on the "layer switcher" once it has been added to the map.

Fell free to refer to it as an example, but try to set up your own WMS server as soon as possible.

dataSources.baseLayers:
blue
bluemarble:bluemarble
chalk
graphite
openstreetmap
Wayne
dataSources.comment:
OpenGeo layers
This application can only handle WebCache service which provide tiles for all layers of the WMS server. For services like this one, which only provide WebCache for a few layers, an extra data source, referencing the WebCache service, has to be added. See the data source "OpenGeo WebCache" for more info.
Some layers from this server only contains tiles about New-York, USA. This data source blacklist all of them by adding a layer pattern in the "Black listed layers" of the "Advanced options".
Note that the legend of some layers has been deactivated using the "Layers' global manual override".
KML Data source having 2 KML in it. See the Advanced tab for the definition of the layer name, description, legend URL, etc.

clients.comment: Demo client to be used as a reference. Feel free to disable or delete this client.
